description:
From cabin +‎ -et, influenced by French cabinet.
In sense of “a government group”, compare salon, also named for a room used to gather.

entries.meaning: A storage closet either separate from, or built into, a wall.
The upright assembly that houses a coin-operated arcade game, a cab.
(historical) A size of photograph, specifically one measuring 3⅞" by 5½".
examples: Holmes took a note of it. “One other question,” said he. “Was the photograph a cabinet?”

entries.meaning: A group of advisors to a government or business entity.

definitionGroups.group: (politics, often capitalized) In parliamentary and some other systems of government, the group of ministers responsible for creating government policy and for overseeing the departments comprising the executive branch.

entries.meaning: (Kentucky) A cabinet-level agency in the executive branch; that is, an agency headed by a member of the governor's cabinet.
(archaic) A small chamber or private room.
(often capitalized) A collection of art or ethnographic objects.

examples: One of Rhode Island's most famous beverages is the Awful Awful, an enormous 32-ounce, rich, creamy milk shake sold at the Newport Creamery stores, a soda fountain and casual restaurant chain. This ultra-thick cabinet is "awful big and awful good," thus the name.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A hut; a cottage; a small house.
examples: Hearken a while from thy green cabinet, / The rural song of careful Colinet.

entries.meaning: An enclosure for mechanical or electrical equipment.
